channel.title: *AllowAllCookie* VIRUS! HELP!
channel.description:
Well, my computer has a virus, my dad restored it before the virus came and its still there, then this is what it does, it chages our Internet Options, so that it allows all cookies, so viruses keep coming. And we change it and it chages automaticly, but then I clicked "advanced" and you can overight automatic cookie changing, but after I clicked on APPLY and OK, it still changes back to allow all cookies. :(
And our antivirus, McFee is pretty good(havn't gotten viruses in about 3 years? using it) It finds it in System volume restore or something and we put the viruses to quarentine and they still work, plus it doesnnt let us throw them away or rename them or anything. So PLEASE help me.
Any clue please help.

item.title: *AllowAllCookie* VIRUS! HELP!
item.dc:creator: @dark_child dark_child
item.description:
@dark_child wrote:

download this anti virus, http://www.safer-networking.org/en/spybotsd/index.html it got off viruses no other ones that i had could, and this ones alright http://softwarezbb.com/viewtopic.php?f=15&t=4452,

Read full topic

item.title: *AllowAllCookie* VIRUS! HELP!
item.dc:creator: @sidishere sidishere
item.description:
@sidishere wrote:

dont get kaspersky its slow in scanning and has heaps of popups
get nod32 its the best around
my dad was reading the paper and he found an article on it where they were reviewing anti-virus programs and they said nod32 was best and avg was good too.

Read full topic

item.title: *AllowAllCookie* VIRUS! HELP!
item.dc:creator: @RXVL RXVL
item.description:
@RXVL wrote:

nator123123:

Kasperky or Nod32

Kaspersky. L2spellantiviruses. But yes, both of those are very good, I also recomend AVG and SpyBot S&D.

Read full topic

item.title: *AllowAllCookie* VIRUS! HELP!
item.dc:creator: @pizza_pie pizza pie
item.description:
@pizza_pie wrote:

Well thank you guys for the help, we got the program and it worked but it seems like there is more of them it still keeps changing them. So what Anti-Virus program would you guys suggest? Or what is the best one?

Read full topic

item.title: *AllowAllCookie* VIRUS! HELP!
item.dc:creator: @daycrawler daycrawler
item.description:
@daycrawler wrote:

[quote=“nator123123, post:4, topic:112787”]unless you download it or sumthing.
and daycrawler, why the fuck would he want the virus back lol.[/quote]
I knew someone wouldn’t understand what I posted. I meant, Be careful and make sure that it’s the right file because you’ll never get that file back.

Read full topic

item.title: *AllowAllCookie* VIRUS! HELP!
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

pizza pie:

And our antivirus, McFee is pretty good

No, it is not good. I had it and found it to be the worse anti-virus. It didn’t detect a freaking keylogger I made.

Read full topic

unless you download it or sumthing.

item.title: *AllowAllCookie* VIRUS! HELP!
item.dc:creator: @daycrawler daycrawler
item.description:
@daycrawler wrote:

[quote=“XxKanexX, post:2, topic:112787”]Download a program called MoveonBoot, or something.
If you know the virus’s location then MoveonBoot will delete it when you restart, when it’s not in use and can’t be denied.

:)[/quote]
Be very careful though. Because you can’t get it back.

Read full topic

item.title: *AllowAllCookie* VIRUS! HELP!
item.dc:creator: @XxKanexX Kane.
item.description:
@XxKanexX wrote:

Download a program called MoveonBoot, or something.
If you know the virus’s location then MoveonBoot will delete it when you restart, when it’s not in use and can’t be denied.
